text.p: Brazilian World Cup striker Romario will not now be rejoining Flamengo on loan, making a permanent move unlikely, a source at his Spanish club Valencia said on Thursday.
The source said the Rio de Janeiro side had abandoned negotiations because of Valencia's insistence on an option to buy Savio, a promising Brazilian forward.
Valencia will continue to negotiate with other clubs to secure a transfer for Romario, who has been repeatedly dropped by coach Luis Aragones because of a lack of match fitness.
On Wednesday, Valencia had said Romario would return on loan to his former Brazilian club until June 30 next year.
Romario is currently in Brazil, where he has spent 21 of his 78 days as a Valencia player.
